intro: Ptarmica clavennae, commonly known as the Alpine gentian, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Ptarmica clavennae has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in summer. It is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often found in mountainous habitats across the Alps.
